perturbation.original_text: Within fifteen (15) Business Days after the end of each month during the Term, each Party shall provide to the other Party a written report setting forth (i) the number of Details completed during such month and (ii) any changes to Incentive Compensation or selling position of the Product by Sales Representatives during such month. Exact shall provide to Pfizer a weekly report detailing, on an Eligible Prescriber-by-Eligible Prescriber basis, the Product Laboratory Services activity, including but not limited to, the number of orders received, number of shipments sent to patients, and number of results sent back to prescriber.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party will provide the other Party a written report every 60 days, detailing (i) the number of Details completed and (ii) changes to Sales Representatives' Incentive Compensation. Exact will report Product Laboratory Services activity monthly.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the reporting frequency from within fifteen (15) business days to every 60 days introduces a delay. Many laws, including those related to healthcare compliance and financial reporting, require more frequent and timely reporting to ensure accurate monitoring and compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Various state and federal healthcare compliance and financial reporting regulations

perturbation.original_text: Exact, within thirty (30) days after the end of each Calendar Quarter of the Term, shall deliver to Pfizer a consolidated report in the form of and containing the information necessary to confirm the calculation of the Promotion Fee for such Calendar Quarter, together with the underlying spreadsheets with respect to such Calendar Quarter. The Promotion Fee due with respect to such Calendar Quarter and reflected on the consolidated report shall be remitted at the time such report is made.
perturbation.changed_text: Exact will deliver a Promotion Fee report to Pfizer at the company's convenience. Payment will be remitted whenever possible.
perturbation.explanation: The original text specifies a clear deadline (thirty days after each calendar quarter) for delivering the report and remitting the Promotion Fee. By changing this to 'at the company's convenience' and 'whenever possible,' the modification introduces ambiguity and violates standard accounting principles that require specific payment timelines. This could also run afoul of regulations that mandate timely payments to contractors/partners.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Accounting Principles (GAAP) and potential breach of contract laws regarding timely payments.

perturbation.original_text: Each Party agrees to obtain and maintain, during the Term and for five (5) years after the Term, commercial general liability insurance, including products liability insurance, with minimum "A-" AM Best rated insurance carriers, in each case with limits of not less than five million dollars ($5,000,000) per occurrence and in the aggregate.
perturbation.changed_text: Each Party agrees to attempt to obtain general liability insurance during the Term.
perturbation.explanation: The original text has clearly stated minimum insurance coverage requirements, whereas the changed text does not hold each party accountable for maintaining the specified insurance. Depending on the industry and agreements, liability insurance is legally necessary to protect the parties in case of damages or legal costs.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of contract and failure to meet standard business practice requiring insurance coverage.
